metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6886 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An error within the "parse_tiff_ifd()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions before 0.18.2 can be exploited to corrupt memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6886` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1
libraw9 - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> All non-libraw packages listed here matched portions of the patch; an extensive analysis was not performed.

criterions.comment: darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
dcraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

freeimage: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libraw package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1').
